KPK: Kemensos Harus Punya Data Akurat Warga Miskin
04 Nov 2019, 05:45 by Siska Nirmala
JAKARTA, (PR).- Komisi Pemberantasan Korupsi (KPK) meminta Kementerian Sosial (Kemensos) agar mempunyai data yang akurat mengenai warga miskin agar bantuan menjadi tepat sasaran.
"Kita terutama sangat menginginkan dalam waktu cepat, pemerintah bisa mempunyai data yang akurat mengenai orang miskin," kata Ketua KPK Agus Rahardjo usai bertemu dengan Mensos Juliari Batubara di gedung KPK, Jakarta, Senin, 4 November 2019, seperti dilansir Kantor Berita Antara.
Agus mencontohkan soal elpiji 3 kilogram atau biasa disebut gas "melon" yang tidak tersalur dengan baik akibat ketidakakuratan data tersebut.
"Dalam rapat saya juga jelaskan, akibat ketidakakuratan data itu, misalnya gas 'melon' untuk orang miskin kemudian gas 'melon' itu ke mana-mana. Listrik juga begitu kemudian subsidi pupuk, benih, kemudian juga bantuan pendidikan, bantuan BPJS. Kalau kita bisa mengelola data itu lebih baik, datanya lebih akurat saya pikir efisiensi untuk anggaran kita akan sangat besar," kata Agus.
Selain itu, Agus juga menyatakan bahwa lembaganya mempunyai sistem "Monitoring Center for Prevention" (MCP) yang nantinya bisa dijadikan salah satu indikator untuk pencegahan korupsi di Kemensos.
"Salah satunya tadi kami akan masukkan, kami punya MCP dan di situ untuk memang data mengenai Kemensos belum ada nanti kita akan jadikan salah satu indikator," kata Agus.
Sementara itu, Mensos Juliari Batubara mengatakan bahwa masukan-masukan dari KPK, khususnya soal data yang akurat tersebut sangat berpengaruh kepada kualitas program-program pemerintah di bidang kesejahteraan sosial.
"Saya kira kami terima dengan baik tadi banyak sekali masukan-masukan dan semuanya masukan dari KPK sangat konstruktif. Kami akan menjalankannya tentunya dengan skala prioritas dan bertahap di mana ujungnya nanti kita jadi kementerian tidak saja 'good and clean governance' juga benar-benar kita memiliki program yang menyejahterakan rakyat Indonesia," ujarnya, seperti dilansir Kantor Berita Antara.
Untuk mencapai data yang akurat itu, kata dia, Kemensos juga akan berkoordinasi dengan Kemendagri agar pemberian bantuan harus berbasis data dari nomor induk kependudukan (NIK).
"Kami kan mengelola data banyak sekali dan pengguna dari data kami data terpadu kesejahteraan sosial, tidak hanya Kemensos juga ada di Kemenkes juga ada yang lainnya di Kementan. Kami juga nanti perlu berkoordinasi dengan kementerian lain misalnya dengan Kemendagri menyangkut data-data yang harus berbasis NIK. Ini bentuk konkret yang akan segera kita tindak lanjuti berkoordinasi bersama dengan kementerian-kementerian tersebut," tuturnya.
Sementara terkait sistem MCP, Mensos menyatakan bahwa sistem tersebut bisa menjadi salah alat kontrol kerja kementeriannya di masa datang.
"Ada beberapa indikator memang tadi saya langsung sampaikan keinginan saya dari Kemensos untuk memasukkan satu indikator dari Kemensos di dalam beberapa indikator yang sudah ada di dalam MCP itu sehingga itu juga merupakan salah satu alat kontrol kami dalam bekerja di masa yang akan datang," kata Mensos.***

KPK: Ministry of Social Affairs Must Have Accurate Data on Poor Citizens
Nov 04 2019, 05:45 by Siska Nirmala
JAKARTA, (PR) .- The Corruption Eradication Commission (KPK) asks the Ministry of Social Affairs (Ministry of Social Affairs) to have accurate data on the poor so that aid is right on target.
"We especially want the government to have accurate data on the poor," KPK Chairman Agus Rahardjo said after meeting with Social Minister Juliari Coal at the KPK building, Jakarta, Monday, November 4, 2019, as reported by Antara News Agency.
Agus gave an example of 3 kg LPG or so-called "melon" gas which was not well channeled due to inaccurate data.
"In the meeting I also explained, due to the inaccuracy of the data, for example 'melon' gas for the poor then the 'melon' gas went everywhere. Electricity was also then subsidized fertilizers, seeds, then also educational assistance, BPJS assistance. If we can manage the data better, the data is more accurate I think the efficiency for our budget will be very large, "Agus said.
In addition, Agus also stated that his institution had a "Monitoring Center for Prevention" (MCP) system which could later be used as an indicator for preventing corruption in the Ministry of Social Affairs.
"One of them we will enter, we have an MCP and there is indeed no data on the Ministry of Social Affairs and we will make it an indicator," Agus said.
Meanwhile, Social Minister Juliari Batubara said that the inputs from the KPK, especially the matter of accurate data, were very influential on the quality of government programs in the field of social welfare.
"I think we received well a lot of input and all input from the Corruption Eradication Commission is very constructive. We will carry it out of course with a priority and gradual scale, where at the end we will become ministries, not only 'good and clean governance' but also really us has a program that brings prosperity to the people of Indonesia, "he said, as reported by the Antara News Agency.
To achieve such accurate data, he said, the Ministry of Social Affairs will also coordinate with the Ministry of Home Affairs so that the provision of assistance must be based on data from the population registration number (NIK).
"We manage a lot of data and users from our data are integrated data on social welfare, not only the Ministry of Social Affairs is also in the Ministry of Health but also others in the Ministry of Agriculture. We also need to coordinate with other ministries, for example with the Ministry of Home Affairs concerning data that must be based on NIK "This is a concrete form which we will immediately follow up in coordination together with these ministries," he said.
While related to the MCP system, the Minister stated that the system could become a means of controlling the work of his ministry in the future.
"There are a number of indicators indeed, I immediately conveyed my desire from the Ministry of Social Affairs to include one indicator from the Ministry of Social Affairs in some of the indicators that already exist in the MCP so that it is also one of our control tools in working in the future," said the Minister . ***
